entry.title: BuddhaDust: Suttas
entry.content:
A complete copy of the four main Nikāyas of the Sutta Piṭaka in their original language, along with many fine translations in English, including M. Old’s entertaining and thoughtful originals.

Bits and scraps, crumbs, fine
Particles that drift down to
Walkers of The Walk.
entry.summary: A complete copy of the four main Nikāyas of the Sutta Piṭaka in their original language, along with many fine translations in English, including M. Old’s entertaining and thoughtful originals.

entry.title: Map of the Taisho
entry.content:
The Taishō is the modern edition of the Mahayana Canon. You may have seen Taishō numbers before to refer to Mahayana Sutras (e.g. T100). This lengthy PDF gives an overview of the numbering scheme and points out specific numbers for many popular Mahayana texts.

Useful both as a reference and just to get a sense of how large the Canon is.
entry.summary: The Taishō is the modern edition of the Mahayana Canon. You may have seen Taishō numbers before to refer to Mahayana Sutras (e.g. T100). This lengthy PDF gives an overview of the numbering scheme and points out specific numbers for many popular Mahayana texts.

entry.title: Saṃyukta Āgama Parallels
entry.content:
A spreadsheet showing the reconstructed “proper” order of the SA discourses, along with a table of their known parallels in the Pāli and Āgama Canons.

The table is based on Yinshun’s original work on the SA in Chinese. You can find a discussion about the table on SuttaCentral here.

entry.title: Highlights of the Four Nikayas
entry.content:
Four handouts giving an overview of the four primary nikayas (books) of the Sutta Pitaka, including calling out a smattering of individual suttas you may want to read to get a general idea of their contents.

You can also access the PDFs on Google Drive at the links below:

  • Highlights from the AN.pdf
  • Highlights from the DN.pdf
  • Highlights from the MN.pdf
  • Highlights from the SN.pdf
